text:
Hi,

I have several different server running fine, only óne with Apache/1.3.34 
(Ubuntu) does't even start withe the diretives:
<Location /xxx/xx/html/xxx_yyy>
SSLRequireSSL
SSLVerifyClient      require
SSLVerifyDepth       1
SSLRequireSSL
SSLOptions              +StrictRequire +FakeBasicAuth
SSLRequire           %{SSL_CLIENT_S_DN_O}  eq "xyz" and %{SSL_CLIENT_S_DN_
</Location>
Is this a bug or does this apache version needs  different diretives?
SSL without client auth works fine on this server, client auth with the same CA 
on other machines is also ok. Any idea? Thanks in advance
creator: oliver.schuppart@dna-gmbh.de
jorton@redhat.com
text:
Please try mailing modssl-users@modssl.org for questions about using mod_ssl
with httpd 1.3.  Only mod_ssl in 2.x is handled here.
